intro: Erophila verna var. radians, commonly known as the early yellow gentian, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in woodland or grassland habitats. Its flowers are tubular and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments, showcasing its adaptability to different light conditions.
